sentence.Network_en: There are restaurants, both humble and expensive, that specialize in them.
sentence.Network_cn: 专门做这些菜的餐馆既有毫不起眼的也有价格昂贵的。

sentence.Network_en: The bakers specialize in catering for large parties.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些面包师专门负责为大型宴会提供食品.

sentence.Network_en: He decided to specialize in entomology after graduation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他决定毕业后专攻昆虫学.

list.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... special a 特别的；专门的 speciality n 特点；特产 specialize v 专门化，特殊化.
（一）专业（Speciality）：快捷周到的服务+丰富的专业知识+娴熟的业务能力 1、干净整洁的衣着，规范得体的谈吐 2、具备专业房 …
...ing)、大厅(hall)、金属板(plate)、特殊(specials)—范围从温暖的经典弹簧式残响复古音色到TC Electronic纯净但震撼的经典大厅式残 …
专业化（specialization）的问题是它让你成为专家（specialist），切断你与世界上其他任何东西的联系，不仅如此，还切断你与自身 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French spécialiser, from spécial 'special'

entry.tran: 专门从事;专门经营;专门研究;专攻
entry.def: If you specialize in a thing, you know a lot about it and concentrate a great deal of your time and energy on it, especially in your work or when you are studying or training. You also use specialize to talk about a restaurant which concentrates on a particular type of food.

example.ex: ...a University professor who specializes in the history of the Russian empire.
example.tran: 专门研究俄罗斯帝国历史的大学教授

example.ex: ...a Portuguese restaurant which specializes in seafood.
example.tran: 主打海味的葡萄牙餐馆

sentences.sentence: "Could you please specify your criticism of my paper?"

means.word_mean: 4. devote oneself to a special area of work;
5. evolve so as to lead to a new species or develop in a way most suited to the environment

auth_sentence.content: I will...specialize a few of those virtues.
auth_sentence.res_content: I will...specialize a few of those virtues.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I will...specialize a few of those virtues.

auth_sentence.content: As part of Facebook's recent growth spurt, the company has hired developers to specialize in coding computer software.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: As part of Facebook's recent growth spurt, the company has hired developers to specialize in coding computer software.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+specific特有的→共同特有的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 特殊的,专门的;附加的,额外的
stems_affixes.word_buile: speci外观,种类,特别+al……的→adj.特殊的,专门的;附加的,额外的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 明确的,具体的;特定的,特有的
stems_affixes.word_buile: speci外观,种类,特别+fic→具体的,特有的
e+special[adj.特殊的,专门的;附加的,额外的]→adj.特别的, 特殊的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 似是而非的,华而不实的
stems_affixes.word_buile: speci外观,种类,特别+ous……的→外观相似而实质不同
especial[adj.特别的, 特殊的]+ly表副词→adv.特别, 尤其
special特殊的,专门的+ist专家或人→n.专门医师, 专家
special[adj.特殊的,专门的;附加的,额外的]+ity表名词→n.[specialty]特性,性质;专业/长;特产
speci外观,种类,特别+es表复数→[所有]种类
specific[adj.明确的,具体的;特定的,特有的]+ation表名词→n.详述;[常n.]规格,说明书,规范
speci外观,种类,特别+men表物品→n.标本,样本
special[adj.特殊的,专门的;附加的,额外的]+ize化→v.[specialise][in]专攻,专门研究,专业化

stems_affixes.value_cn: 指定, 详细说明, 列入清单
stems_affixes.word_buile: speci外观,种类,特别+ify表动词→specify规类→指定, 列入清单

Sentence.sentence: But as the nursing shortage worsens, a growing number of schools and hospitals are establishing "fast-track programs" that enable college graduates with no nursing experience to become registered nurses with only a year or so of specialized training.
Jonathan Bishop, a researcher in Wales specializing in online communities, is more skeptical.
She did not specialize in the study of law.
It was created by Ludwig Lazar Zamenhof, a Polish Jewish doctor specialized in eye diseases.
Esperanto is used internationally across language boundaries by at least 1 million people, particularly in specialized fields

means.word_mean: 专门从事, 专攻,专门研究

sentences.en: After his first degree he wishes to specialize.
sentences.cn: 获得学士学位之后, 他希望专攻某科。
